alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 5:51PM CDT until July 18 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sequatchie County in east Tennessee... Marion County in east Tennessee... Central Hamilton County in east Tennessee... * Until 745 PM EDT/645 PM CDT/. * At 649 PM EDT/549 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles east of Manchester to near Cowan to 9 miles northeast of Gurley, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Dunlap, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Rossville, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite and Whitwell. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee near mile marker 1. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
